education.field_of_study: Economic and Political Development - Advanced Economic Analysis

education.school: Cal State Fullerton, College of Business and Economics

accomplishment_publications.name: Financially Viable Media in Emerging and Developing Markets: Kenya
accomplishment_publications.description: The report, part of a larger study of media in emerging and developing markets, focuses on a country that has arisen on the world stage as a dynamic new democracy, where technological innovation flourishes, traditional media businesses thrive, and the government operates with unprecedented openness.Print and broadcast media have developed trusted, credible voices and play important roles in the national dialogue. Journalists and technologists have collaborated on energetic, leading-edge projects that are being replicated elsewhere. Kenya is now seen as a beacon of press freedom in the region and is being celebrated for innovation.At the same time, the report notes some troubling realities.The newly free media are subject to crippling reprisals under legacy libel laws. Vast numbers of people are not served by television, smartphones, or the Internet. The infrastructure needed to reach them is expensive and elusive. There are socioeconomic and geographic divides between urban and rural audiences: less than one-quarter of the population lives in urban areas equipped with modern technology. Outside the major cities, mobile and Internet sources of news are unavailable and too often unaffordable and are likely to remain so in the medium term.

accomplishment_publications.name: IC4D 2012: Maximizing Mobile - Making Government Mobile (Chapter 6)
accomplishment_publications.description: Governments are beginning to embrace the potential for mobile technology to put public services literally into the pocket of each citizen, create interactive services, and promote accountable and transparent governance. Chapter 6 identifies a range of uses for mobile technology in government that supplement public services, expand their user base, and generate spinoff services.

accomplishment_publications.name: Costing Critical Child Protection Services In Arusha, Tanzania
accomplishment_publications.publisher: Caucus for Children's Rights & Columbia University-School of International and Public Affairs
accomplishment_publications.description: This study presents a comprehensive set of interventions and their associated costs for improving the provision of child protection services in the Arusha District of Tanzania. The intent of these interventions is to provide concrete, actionable recommendations in order to operationalize aspects of the country’s Law of the Child Act which was passed in 2009.

accomplishment_projects.title: Cairo Traffic App Competition
accomplishment_projects.description: Led a team working out of Nairobi and New York on a traffic-related mobile application. This application sought to address traffic and congestion problems in downtown Cairo.

recommendations:
Jeff Emanuelli



I worked with Matt on a high profile project for the Training team.  He was the subject matter expert and was extremely good at answering questions and providing deliverables on time.  I also learned to rely on Matt for matters of everyday when a question arose in the Training dept., I knew that I could get a definitive answer from Matt.  I would highly recommend Matt for any position he chose to pursue knowing full well that he can excell anywhere in the corporate environment.

Patrick Condello



I have worked with Matt over the past few years as the Bank has support WAM as a fund adminstrator. Matt is very knowledagble and has been extremely approachable as it relates to anything fund related. Matt also has taken the time to explain anything that the Bank has not previously been expose to. It has been a pleasure working with him.

David Friskics



Matthew's passion for learning and his ability to solve even the most complex of problems make him a well-rounded employee.  He is a pleasure to work with, and will stay until the job gets done.  From speaking with his other colleagues, I can conclude that Matthew is a real Team Player.

Donna Banayad



Matthew Cruse is a pleasure to work with.  He is a hard working individual that has wonderful communication skills and is a great team player.

Lucas Blocker, CFA



Matthew is a strong project manager who maps out his objectives first and then combines his talented technical skills with a sense of follow-up to drive all of his stakeholders toward a common goal.  I've witnessed Matt execute all of the most important phases of a project:  tasking, scheduling, budgeting, coordination/monitoring, and completion.  Matt could even carry projects through definition and have others pick up control, or pick up control after others completed definition.  With usually more than one under his leadership, Matt could juggle projects that were in differnent phases at any given moment.  These attributes were important in an ever changing environment of new financial requirements, regulations, and client wish lists.

Mallory Gompert



Matthew would be an asset to any organization, and I am pleased to recommend him without reservation. I worked with him as he directed the event committee, social marketing, media coverage, event logistics, and volunteer management for our largest Walk to End Alzheimer's at Cal State Fullerton, which attracts over 4,000 people and raises nearly $400,000. Matthew demonstrated great resourcefulness, dedication and diplomacy in every situation. These qualities earned him an indelible and extremely positive impression on Alzheimer’s Association staff, donors and volunteers.
